Metadata.Name: NENA - Validations
Metadata.Comments: Branch: master\nRecent Commits:\n

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - AdNumPre_L
Metadata.Description:
Address Number Prefix:
Description: An extension of the Address Number that precedes it and further 654 identifies a location along a thoroughfare or within a defined area.
Domain: None
Example: â€œ75-â€� in â€œ75-6214 Kailua Placeâ€�; â€œ3W2N-â€� in â€œ3W2N-4551â€�
Note: The Address Number Prefix contains any alphanumeric characters, punctuation, and spaces preceding the Address Number. This element is a conditional element. For more details, please see NENA Next Generation 9-1-1 (NG9-1-1) United States Civic Location Data Exchange Format (CLDXF) Standard (NENA-STA-004) [2].

pg 44
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - AdNumPre_R
Metadata.Description:
Address Number Prefix:
Description: An extension of the Address Number that precedes it and further 654 identifies a location along a thoroughfare or within a defined area.
Domain: None
Example: â€œ75-â€� in â€œ75-6214 Kailua Placeâ€�; â€œ3W2N-â€� in â€œ3W2N-4551â€�
Note: The Address Number Prefix contains any alphanumeric characters, punctuation, and spaces preceding the Address Number. This element is a conditional element. For more details, please see NENA Next Generation 9-1-1 (NG9-1-1) United States Civic Location Data Exchange Format (CLDXF) Standard (NENA-STA-004) [2].

pg 44
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - AddCode_L
Metadata.Description:
Additional Code Left: 
Description: The Additional Code on the Left side of the road segment relative to the 625 FROM Node.
Domain: See Additional Code
Example: See Additional Code


Additional Code:
Description: A code that specifies a geographic area. Used in Canada to hold a Standard Geographical Classification code; it differentiates two municipalities with the same name in a province that does not have counties.
Domain: Statistics Canada, Standard Geographical Classification 2011, Volume I, Statistical Area Classification by Province and Territory â€“ Variant of SGC 2011
http://www.statcan.gc.ca/subjects-sujets/standard-norme/sgc-cgt/2011/index-indexe-eng.htm
Example: 3318013; 55091

pg 43
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - AddCode_R
Metadata.Description:
Additional Code Right:
Description: The Additional Code on the Right side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node.
Domain: See Additional Code
Example: See Additional Code


Additional Code:
Description: A code that specifies a geographic area. Used in Canada to hold a Standard Geographical Classification code; it differentiates two municipalities with the same name in a province that does not have counties.
Domain: Statistics Canada, Standard Geographical Classification 2011, Volume I, Statistical Area Classification by Province and Territory â€“ Variant of SGC 2011
http://www.statcan.gc.ca/subjects-sujets/standard-norme/sgc-cgt/2011/index-indexe-eng.htm
Example: 3318013; 55091

pg 43
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - ESN_L
Metadata.Description:
ESN Left:
Description: The Emergency Service Number (ESN) on the Left side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node.
Domain: Characters from 000 to 99999
Example: 5422; 124;

pg 53
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - ESN_R
Metadata.Description:
ESN Right:
Description: The Emergency Service Number (ESN) on the Right side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node.
Domain: Characters from 000 to 99999
Example: 5423; 125;

pg 54
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - LSt_Name
Metadata.Description:
Legacy Street Name Type:
Description: The valid street abbreviation as it previously existed prior to the adoption of the NG9-1-1 Data Model as assigned by the local addressing authority.
Domain: As it existed prior to the adoption of the NG9-1-1 Data Model; MAY be blank
Example: â€œSTâ€� for â€œSTREET,â€� â€œSTRâ€� for â€œSTREET,â€� â€œBLVDâ€� for â€œBOULEVARD,â€� 1167 â€œAVEâ€� for â€œAVENUE,â€� â€œTRACEâ€� for â€œTRACEâ€�

pg 59
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - LSt_PosDir
Metadata.Description:
Legacy Street Name Post Directional:
Description: The trailing street direction suffix as it previously existed prior to the adoption of the NG9-1-1 Data Model as assigned by the local addressing authority.
Domain: N, S, E, W, NE, NW, SE, SW
Example: â€œEâ€� in â€œCHURCH ST Eâ€�

pg 58
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - LSt_PreDir
Metadata.Description:
Legacy Street Name Pre DirectionalL:
Description: The leading street direction prefix as it previously existed prior to the adoption of the NG9-1-1 Data Model as assigned by the local addressing authority.
Domain: N, S, E, W, NE, NW, SE, SW
Example: â€œSâ€� in â€œS PINE AVEâ€�

pg 59
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - LSt_Type
Metadata.Description:
Legacy Street Name Type:
Description: The valid street abbreviation as it previously existed prior to the adoption of the NG9-1-1 Data Model as assigned by the local addressing authority.
Domain: As it existed prior to the adoption of the NG9-1-1 Data Model; MAY be blank
Example: â€œSTâ€� for â€œSTREET,â€� â€œSTRâ€� for â€œSTREET,â€� â€œBLVDâ€� for â€œBOULEVARD,â€� â€œAVEâ€� for â€œAVENUE,â€� â€œTRACEâ€� for â€œTRACEâ€�

pg 59
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - MSAGComm_L
Metadata.Description:
MSAG Community Name Left:
Description: The existing MSAG Community Name on the Left side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node.
Domain: None
Example: Harris County
Note: Used in Legacy Systems and is not used in a full NG9-1-1 implementation.

pg 61
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - MSAGComm_R
Metadata.Description:
MSAG Community Name Right:
Description: The existing MSAG Community Name on the Right side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node.
Domain: None
Example: Crystal City
Note: Used in Legacy Systems and is not used in a full NG9-1-1 implementation.

pg 61
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - St_PosDir
Metadata.Description:
Street Name Post Directional:
Description: A word following the Street Name element that indicates the direction taken by the road from an arbitrary starting point or line, or the sector where it is located.
Domain: North, South, East, West, Northeast, Northwest, Southeast, Southwest
Example: â€œNorthâ€� in â€œElm Avenue Northâ€�
Note: This element is a conditional element. For more details, please see NENA Next Generation 9-1-1 (NG9-1-1) United States Civic Location Data Exchange Format (CLDXF) Standard (NENA-STA-004) [2].

pg 72
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - St_PosMod
Metadata.Description:
Street Name Post Modifier:
Description: A word or phrase that follows and modifies the Street Name element, but is separated from it by a Street Name Post Type or a Street Name Post Directional or both.
Domain: None
Example: â€œNumber 5â€� in â€œFire Road Number 5â€�
â€œExtensionâ€� in â€œMain Street North Extensionâ€�
Note: This element is a conditional element. For more details, please see NENA Next Generation 9-1-1 (NG9-1-1) United States Civic Location Data Exchange Format (CLDXF) Standard (NENA-STA-004) [2].

pg 72
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - St_PosTyp
Metadata.Description:
Street Name Post Type:
Description: A word or phrase that follows the Street Name element and identifies a type of thoroughfare in a complete street name.
Domain: Restricted to values found in the â€œNENA Registry of Street Name Pre Types and Street Name Post Typesâ€� or combinations thereof. http://technet.nena.org/nrs/registry/StreetNamePreTypesAndStreetNamePostTypes.xml
Example: â€œParkwayâ€� in â€œOcean Parkwayâ€�
Note: This element is a conditional element. For more details, please see NENA Next Generation 9-1-1 (NG9-1-1) United States Civic Location Data Exchange Format (CLDXF) Standard (NENA-STA-004) [2].

pg 72
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - St_PreDir
Metadata.Description:
Street Name Pre Directional:
Description: A word preceding the Street Name element that indicates the direction taken by the road from an arbitrary starting point or line, or the sector where it is located.
Domain: North, South, East, West, Northeast, Northwest, Southeast, Southwest
Example: â€œSouthâ€� in â€œSouth Congress Avenueâ€�
Note: This element is a conditional element. For more details, please see NENA Next Generation 9-1-1 (NG9-1-1) United States Civic Location Data Exchange Format (CLDXF) Standard (NENA-STA-004) [2].

pg 73
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - St_PreMod
Metadata.Description:
Street Name Pre Modifier:
Description: A word or phrase that precedes and modifies the Street Name element but is separated from it by a Street Name Pre Type or a Street Name Pre Directional or both.
Domain: None
Example: â€œAlternateâ€� in â€œAlternate Route 8â€�
â€œOldâ€� in â€œOld North Church Streetâ€�
Note: This element is a conditional element. For more details, please see NENA Next Generation 9-1-1 (NG9-1-1) United States Civic Location Data Exchange Format (CLDXF) Standard (NENA-STA-004) [2].

pg 73
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - St_PreSep
Metadata.Description:
Street Name Pre Type Separator:
Description: A preposition or prepositional phrase between the Street Name Pre Type and the Street Name. This element is defined in CLDXF (NENA-STA-004) [2] as a US specific extension of PIDF-LO per RFC 6848 [5].
Doman: Restricted to values found in the â€œNENA Registry of Street Name Pre Type Separators.â€� http://technet.nena.org/nrs/registry/StreetNamePreTypeSeparators.xml
Example: â€œof theâ€� in â€œAvenue of the Starsâ€�
Note: This element is a conditional element. For more details, please see NENA Next Generation 9-1-1 (NG9-1-1) United States Civic Location Data Exchange Format (CLDXF) Standard (NENA-STA-004) [2].

pg 74
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - St_PreTyp
Metadata.Description:
Street Name Pre Type:
Description: A word or phrase that precedes the Street Name element and identifies a type of thoroughfare in a complete street name.
Domain: Restricted to values found in the â€œNENA Registry of Street Name Pre Types and
Street Name Post Typesâ€� or combinations thereof. http://technet.nena.org/nrs/registry/StreetNamePreTypesAndStreetNamePostTypes.xml
Example:
â€œAvenueâ€� in â€œAvenue Aâ€�
â€œHighwayâ€� in â€œHighway 443â€�
â€œBypass Highwayâ€� in â€œBypass Highway 22â€�
â€œBoulevardâ€� in â€œBoulevard of the Alliesâ€�
Note: Occasionally two or more type words occur together before the Street Name element (e.g., Bypass Highway 22). All of the words are placed in the Street Name Pre Type, unless the local address authority has included any of them in Street Name element. If the two type words are not part of the Street Name element and are not separated from each other by a directional word or other word, they are all placed in the Street Name Pre Type. This element is a conditional element. For more details, please see NENA Next Generation 9-1-1 (NG9-1-1) United States Civic Location Data Exchange Format (CLDXF) Standard (NENA-STA-004) [2].

pg 73
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - Country_L
Metadata.Description:
Country Left:
Description: The name of the Country on the Left side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node, represented by its two-letter ISO 3166-1 English country alpha-2 code 836 elements in capital ASCII letters.
Domain: Restricted to the two-letter designations provided in ISO 3166-1.
Example: "US" for the United States of America; "CA" for Canada

pg 49
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - Country_R
Metadata.Description:
Country Right:
Description: The name of the Country on the Right side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node, represented by its two-letter ISO 3166-1 English country alpha-2 code elements in capital ASCII letters.
Domain: Restricted to the two-letter designations provided in ISO 3166-1.
Example: "US" for the United States of America; "MX" for Mexico

pg 49
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - County_L
Metadata.Description:
County Left:
Description: The name of a County or County-equivalent on the Left side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node. A county (or its equivalent) is the primary legal division of a state or territory.
Domain: See County
Example: St. Louis County; Adams County

pg 50
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - County_R
Metadata.Description:
County Right:
Description: The name of a County or County-equivalent on the Right side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node. A county (or its equivalent) is the primary legal division of a state or territory.
Domain: See County
Example: St. Johns County; DeSoto County; DoÃ±a Ana County

pg 51
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - DateUpdate
Metadata.Description:
Date Updated:
Description: The date and time that the record was created or last modified. This value
MUST be populated upon modifications to attributes, geometry, or both.
Domain: Date and Time may be stored in the local database date/time format with the proviso that local time zone MUST be recorded and time MUST be recorded to a precision of at least 1 second and MAY be recorded to a precision of 0.1 second. If the local database date/time format does not meet these specifications, the database SHOULD record both the local date/time format and a string conforming to W3C dateTime format as described in XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition [10].
Example: (of a W3C dateTime with optional precision of .1 second)
2017-12-21T17:58.03.1-05:00 (representing a record updated on December 21, 2017 at 5:58 and 3.1 seconds PM US Eastern Standard Time); 2017-07-11T08:31:15.2-04:00 (representing a record updated on July 11, 2017 at 8:31
and 15.2 seconds AM US Eastern Daylight Time)
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - DiscrpAgID
Metadata.Description:
Discrepancy Agency ID:
Description: Agency that receives a Discrepancy Report (DR), should a discrepancy be discovered, and will take responsibility for ensuring discrepancy resolution. This may or may not be the same as the 9-1-1 Authority. This MUST be represented by a domain name that is an Agency Identifier as defined in the NENA Master Glossary.
Domain: None
Example: Vermont911.vt.us.gov; nct911.dst.tx.us

pg 51
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - FromAddr_L
Metadata.Description:
Left FROM Address: 
Description: In a GIS, each line segment has a begin point and an endpoint. The FROM Node is the begin point of the linestring while the TO Node is the endpoint. Line segments have a left side and a right side relative to a begin node and an end node. The Left FROM address is the address number on the Left side of the road segment relative to the Left FROM Node of the linestring. Note: This address can be higher than the Left TO Address. 
Domain: Whole numbers from 1 to 9,999,999

pg 57
Metadata.Comments: Modified to allow a value of zero\nInitial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - FromAddr_R
Metadata.Description:
Right FROM Address:
Description: In a GIS, each line segment has a begin point and an endpoint. The FROM Node is the begin point of the linestring while the TO node is the endpoint. Line segments have a left side and a right side relative to a begin node and an end node. The Right FROM address number is the address number on the Right side of the road segment relative to the Right FROM Node of the linestring. Note: This address can be higher than the Right TO Address. 
Domain: Whole numbers from 1 to 9,999,999

pg 66
Metadata.Comments: Modified to allow a value of zero\nInitial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - Global ID
Metadata.Description:
Road Centerline NENA Globally Unique ID:
Description: The NENA Globally Unique ID for each Road Centerline. Each record in the Road Centerlines layer MUST have a globally unique ID. When coalescing data from other local 9-1-1 Authorities into the ECRF and LVF, this unique ID MUST continue to have only one occurrence. One way to accomplish this is to append the 9-1-1 Authorityâ€™s domain to the end of the â€œlocally unique IDâ€�.
Domain: None
Example: Feature ID 6237 in the Road Centerline layer would be represented as RCL6237@911Authority_domain.state.us

pg 67
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - IncMuni_L
Metadata.Description:
Incorporated Municipality Left:
Description: The name of the Incorporated Municipality or other general-purpose local governmental unit (if any), on the Left side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node.
Domain: None; however, use "Unincorporated" if the address is not within an incorporated local government.
Example: Lexington; Columbus; Unincorporated

pg 55
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - IncMuni_R
Metadata.Description:
Incorporated Municipality Right:
Description: The name of the Incorporated Municipality or other general-purpose local governmental unit (if any), on the Right side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node.
Domain: None; however, use "Unincorporated" if the address is not within an incorporated local government.
Example: Tampa; Yonkers; Unincorporated

pg 56
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - Parity_L
Metadata.Description:
Parity Left:
Description: The even or odd property of the address number range on the Left side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node.
Domain: O=Odd, E=Even, B=Both, Z=Address Range 0-0
Example: O; E; B; Z

pg 62
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - Parity_R
Metadata.Description:
Parity Right:
Description: The even or odd property of the address number range on the Right side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node. 
Domain: O=Odd, E=Even, B=Both, Z=Address Range 0-0 or Address Range NULL-NULL 
Example: O; E; B; Z

pg 63
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - St_Name
Metadata.Description:
Street Name:
Description: The official name of the road, usually defined by the lowest jurisdictional authority (e.g. city). The street name does not include any street types, directionals, or modifiers.
Domain: None
Example: â€œFifthâ€� in â€œFifth Avenueâ€�
Note: This element is a conditional element. For more details, please see NENA Next Generation 9-1-1 (NG9-1-1) United States Civic Location Data Exchange Format (CLDXF) Standard (NENA-STA-004) [2].

pg 72
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - State_L
Metadata.Description:
State Left:
Description: The name of a state or state equivalent on the Left side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node, represented by the two-letter abbreviation given in USPS Publication 28 [14], Appendix B.
Domain: ISO 3166-2 or USPS Publication 28 [14], Appendix B for the US
Example: LA; OK

pg 71
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - State_R
Metadata.Description:
State Right:
Description: The name of a state or state equivalent on the Right side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node, represented by the two-letter abbreviation given in USPS Publication 28 [14], Appendix B.
Domain: ISO 3166-2 or USPS Publication 28 [14], Appendix B for the US
Example: PA; KY

pg 71
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - ToAddr_L
Metadata.Description:
Left TO Address:
Description: In a GIS, each line segment has a begin point and an endpoint. The FROM Node is the begin point of the linestring while the TO Node is the endpoint. Line segments have a left side and a right side relative to a begin node and an end node. The Left TO address is the address number on the Left side of the road segment relative to the Left TO Node of the linestring. Note: This address can be lower than the Left FROM Address. 
Domain: Whole numbers from 1 to 9,999,999

pg 58
Metadata.Comments: Modified to allow a value of zero\nInitial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - ToAddr_R
Metadata.Description:
Right TO Address:
Description: In a GIS, each line segment has a begin point and an endpoint. The FROM Node is the begin point of the linestring while the TO node is the endpoint. Line segments have a left side and a right side relative to a begin node and an end node. The Right TO address number is the address number on the Right side of the road segment relative to the Right TO Node of the linestring. Note: This address can be lower than the Right FROM Address. 
Domain: Whole numbers from 1 to 9,999,999 
Example: See Figure 5-3

pg 67
Metadata.Comments: Modified to allow a value of zero\nInitial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - Effective
Metadata.Description:
Effective Date:
Description: The date and time that the record is scheduled to take effect.
Domain: Date and Time may be stored in the local database date/time format with the proviso that local time zone MUST be recorded and time MUST be recorded to a precision of at least 1 second and MAY be recorded to a precision of 0.1 second. If the local database date/time format does not meet these specifications, the database SHOULD record both the local date/time format and a string conforming to W3C dateTime format as described in XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition [10].
Example: (of a W3C dateTime with optional precision of .1 second)
2017-02-18T02:30:00.1-05:00 (representing a record that will become active on February 18, 2017 at 2:30 and 0.1 seconds AM US Eastern Standard Time);
2017-10-09T13:01:35.2-04:00 (representing a record that will become active on October 9, 2017 at 1:01 and 35.2 seconds PM US Eastern Daylight Time)
Note: This field is used when time and date of a change is known. For example, the time and date an annexation takes effect.
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - Expire
Metadata.Description:
Expiration Date:
Description: The date and time when the information in the record is no longer considered valid.
Domain: Date and Time may be stored in the local database date/time format with the proviso that local time zone MUST be recorded and time MUST be recorded to a precision of at least 1 second and MAY be recorded to a precision of 0.1 second. If the local database date/time format does not meet these specifications, the database SHOULD record both the local date/time format and a string conforming to W3C dateTime format as described in XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition [10].
Example: (of a W3C dateTime with optional precision of .1 second)
2017-02-18T02:30:00-05:00.1 (representing a record that will expire and no longer be valid on February 18, 2017 at 2:30 and 0.1 seconds AM US Eastern Standard Time);
2017-10-09T13:01:35.2-04:00 (representing a record that will expire and no longer be valid on October 9, 2017 at 1:01 and 35.2 seconds PM US Eastern Daylight Time)
Note: This field is used when the time and date of a change is known. For example, the time and date an annexation takes effect and the previous boundary is retired.
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - NbrhdCom_L
Metadata.Description:
Neighborhood Community Left:
Description: The name of an unincorporated neighborhood, subdivision or area, either within an incorporated municipality or in an unincorporated portion of a county or both, on the Left side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node.
Domain: None
Example: East Harlem; Cypress Meadows Subdivision

pg 61
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - NbrhdCom_R
Metadata.Description:
Neighborhood Community Right:
Description: The name of an unincorporated neighborhood, subdivision or area, either within an incorporated municipality or in an unincorporated portion of a county or both, on the Right side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node.
Domain: None
Example: Edgewater Park; The Meadows

pg 61
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - OneWay
Metadata.Description:
One-Way:
Description: The direction of traffic movement along a road in relation to the FROM node and TO node of the line segment representing the road in the GIS data. The one-way field has three possible designations: B (Both), FT (From-To) and TF (To-From).
B â€“ Travel in both directions allowed
FT â€“ One-way traveling from FROM node to TO node
TF â€“ One way traveling from TO node to FROM node
Domain: B, FT, TF

pg 62
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - PostCode_L
Metadata.Description:
Postal Code Left:
Description: The Postal Code on the Left side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node.
Domain: See Postal Code
Example: 44114 (Postal Code in Cleveland, OH); H3B 3B0 (Canadian Postal Code in Montreal, QC)

pg 64
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - PostCode_R
Metadata.Description:
Postal Code Right:
Description: The Postal Code on the Right side of the road segment relative to the 1340 FROM Node.
Domain: See Postal Code
Example: 84101 (Postal Code in Salt Lake City, UT); R3C 3Z0 (Canadian Postal Code in Winnipeg, MB)

pg 64
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - PostComm_L
Metadata.Description:
Postal Community Name Left:
Description: A city name for the ZIP Code of an address, as given in the USPS City State file on the Left side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node.
Domain: See Postal Community Name
Example: Dublin; Magnolia

pg 64
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - PostComm_R
Metadata.Description:
Postal Community Name Right:
Description: A city name for the ZIP Code of an address, as given in the USPS City State file on the Right side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node.
Domain: See Postal Community Name
Example: Wicket; Zanesville

pg 65
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - RoadClass
Metadata.Description:
Road Class:
Description: The general description of the type of road. The Road Classifications used in this document are derived from the US Census MAF/TIGER Feature Classification Codes (MTFCC), which is an update to the now deprecated Census Feature Class Codes (CFCC).
Domain: Primary, Secondary, Local, Ramp, Service Drive, Vehicular Trail, Walkway, Stairway, Alley, Private, Parking Lot, Trail, Bridle Path, Other
Example: Ramp
Note: The Road Class is completely spelled out in the attribute fields. Road Classification is based on the Census road classification found in the MAF/TIGER Feature Class Code (MTFCC) Definitions [13]. The values are taken from the S series information in this document which provided the classification scheme for surface roads and can be found at: https://www.census.gov/geo/reference/mtfcc.html
Some 9-1-1 Authorities may include unnamed and/or un-addressed trails, paths, and similar â€œroadsâ€� in their GIS data. It is recommended that these not be included with the named and addressed roads for provisioning into the ECRF and the LVF databases. Conversely, the Road Classification MAY be populated so these â€œroadsâ€� can be selected for exclusion and not be part of the data provisioned or updated to the ECRF and the LVF.

pgs 67-68
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - SpeedLimit
Metadata.Description:
Speed Limit:
Description: Posted Speed Limit in MPH in US or Km/h in Canada
Domain: Whole numbers from 1 to 999
Example: 35; 55; 70

pg 71
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - UnincCom_L
Metadata.Description:
Unincorporated Community Left:
Description: The Unincorporated Community, either within an incorporated municipality or in an unincorporated portion of a county, or both, on the Left side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node.
Domain: None
Example: Latham (NY); Moose (WY)

pg 74
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - UnincCom_R
Metadata.Description:
Unincorporated Community Right:
Description: The Unincorporated Community, either within an incorporated municipality or in an unincorporated portion of a county, or both, on the Right side of the road segment relative to the FROM Node.
Domain: None
Example: Mountain View (GA); Palmer (MI)

pg 75
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - Valid_L
Metadata.Description:
Validation Left:
Description: Indicates if the address range on the left side of the road segment should be used for civic location validation. A value of â€œYâ€� MAY be entered if any Address Number within the address range on the left side of the road segment should be considered by the LVF to be valid. A value of â€œNâ€� MAY be entered if the Address Number should only be validated using the Site/Structure Address Points layer. If not present, a value of â€œYâ€� is assumed.
Domain: Y, N
Example: Y; N
Note: This field does not affect routing of emergency calls, nor display of GIS data. It controls how the LVF determines its response when an address does not match a Site/Structure Address Point, but is within a valid range of a Road Centerline.

pg 75
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019

Metadata.Name: RCL - Attribute - Validation - Valid_R
Metadata.Description:
Validation Right:
Description: Indicates if the address range on the right side of the road segment should be used for civic location validation. A value of â€œYâ€� MAY be entered if any Address Number within the address range on the right side of the road segment should be considered by the LVF to be valid. A value of â€œNâ€� MAY be entered if the Address Number should only be validated using the Site/Structure Address Points layer. If not present, a value of â€œYâ€� is assumed.
Domain: Y, N
Example: Y; N
Note: This field does not affect routing of emergency calls, nor display of GIS data. It controls how the LVF determines its response when an address does not match a Site/Structure Address Point, but is within a valid range of a Road Centerline.

pg 76
Metadata.Comments: Initial Version - AJ\nUpdated Naming Conventions - AJ - 1/25/2019
